Early days and the A4  Why would Apple want to bring large-scale semiconductor design in-house? It is an expensive endeavor. Would they be able to design comparable, let alone better, ICs than X or Y semiconductor company that was already in the space? Surely, it was too big a risk. They were marketing their Hummingbird Arm-based CPU. This latter acquisition was confirmed in April 2010. On Jan. 27, 2010, Steve Jobs took to the stage to introduce the iPad and the Apple-designed A4 SoC. I thought about the possibly impending tablet and its silicon a week before the keynote. I thought a tablet would require silicon that is between that in the iPhone and a MacBook.
